name: Givelight Foundation
mission: Givelight Foundations primary exempt purpose is to provide shelter, clothing and food to children who have been orphaned by a natural disaster or other global crisis; to provide educational, spiritual and social services to the children residing in these orphanages.
theoryOfChange: Givelight Foundation has a published 'Our Model' page that outlines their strategic approach to establishing and running orphanages globally. This document details a step-by-step process, including researching credible organizations, securing donated land, selecting qualified staff, and providing long-term care and education. The model emphasizes a need-based approach focused on the children's long-term well-being, education, and development to help them reach their full potential.

strengths_deep_dive: GiveLight's primary strength lies in its ability to convert donor capital into direct service with virtually zero leakage. By maintaining a <cite id="6">88.7% program expense ratio</cite>, the foundation ensures that contributions directly fund <cite id="15">orphanage construction and education support</cite>. This is supported by a <cite id="12">94.66666666666667/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>, which validates their financial health and transparency. Furthermore, their <cite id="16">documented theory of change</cite> provides a clear roadmap for how they transition children from crisis to self-sufficiency through stable housing and schooling.
rich_narrative.summary: GiveLight Foundation is a world-recognized crisis relief organization dedicated to <cite id="1">building loving homes and families for orphans</cite> in response to extreme global circumstances. Founded in <cite id="2">2004</cite> following the devastating Indian Ocean tsunami, the organization has expanded its reach to provide long-term care across countries including <cite id="3">Indonesia, Bangladesh, Cambodia, Sri Lanka, Morocco, and Pakistan</cite>. Unlike traditional relief agencies that focus solely on immediate aid, GiveLight emphasizes <cite id="4">orphanage construction and management</cite> alongside education support to ensure children have a stable path to adulthood. The organization operates with a lean financial model, reporting <cite id="5">$2,186,834 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Remarkably, GiveLight maintains a <cite id="6">88.7% program expense ratio</cite> according to recent financial filings, ensuring that every dollar of public contribution is directed toward the care and housing of children. This efficiency is further highlighted by a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent per $1 raised</cite>, a rare metric achieved through a heavy reliance on volunteer networks and strategic partnerships. The foundation’s governance is led by <cite id="8">Founder and CEO Dian Alyan</cite>, who received <cite id="9">$134,108 in compensation</cite> for her leadership of the global operations. With <cite id="10">$11,280,674 in total assets</cite>, the organization maintains significant reserves to ensure the long-term sustainability of the homes it builds, reflecting a commitment to the children that extends far beyond initial crisis intervention.
